CatDescriptText: Miss Cynthia Hampton, nurses' aide, Penn Hills and Tom Jasionowski, business student, McKees Rocks, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 7, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "Do you agree with the Supreme Court's decision against prayer in public schools?"  Ms. Hampton's answer reads: "I think it should depend on a particular school, and what the parents of the children attending that school desire.  It shouldn't be a matter of a court decision."  Mr. Jasionowski's answer reads: "I don't see why not.  They (the Supreme Court justices) are the boss, and we should be willing to go along with them."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Cynthia Hampton wearing arabesque patterned dress, standing in front of Thrift Drugs store, May Building, Fifth Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Tom Jasionowski wearing light colored button down collared shirt with short rolled sleeves, standing in front of Thrift Drugs store, May Building, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
